name: DoubleTree Fallsview Resort & Spa by Hilton - Niagara Falls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We make an annual trip to the Niagara area for a serious bicyle ride day followed by a winery tours day. (Amazing paved trails around there - best cycling I've ever done!)Everything in Niagara on the Lake was fully booked, so we stayed in Niagara Falls. One warning for cyclists: this hotel won't let you take bikes on the elevator or to your room. But they do have a small housekeeping storage room near the front desk where we were able to leave our bikes. It might be able to accommodate six bikes. The bedroom was comfortable, the view quite nice (though you can't see anything if you're in the bed or the whirlpool tub!). We used the indoor pool (we saw two pools next to each other - one was for adults only); the sauna, hot tub and of course the in-room whirlpool tube. All were in good condition. On the minus side: The shower is the smallest shower I've ever seen - I kept knocking the door open with my elbow. We had breakfast at Buchanan's one morning but I wouldn't recommend it. It's a very plain, boring buffet and extremely overpriced (over $40 for two!), and their coffee sucks! So we went somewhere else the next morning. Apart from that, everything else was fine - clean, tasteful, quiet, and the staff was pleasant. We walked to restaurants, bars & attractions, all very close.
reviews.title: High quality, convenient

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I enjoyed this hotel but the rooms were lacking in amenities (not enough coffee and creamer) and the service was average. We felt welcome, but we weren't overwhelmed with hospitality.
reviews.title: Nice but typical

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice hotel, good location close to Fallsview Casino and a great stay for the rate.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We spend two nights there on September 19 & 20th. The internet pictures to do not due the hotel justice. My son went to the Cornell Hotel school and I am very critical of hotels. I could not find anything wrong with the place. The staff was on their game and the accomodations were excellent. We had a king suite on the 11th floor and it was extremely comfortable. The pool and hot tub was great and the hotel architecture has the feel of a Colorado ski resort. The location is great, between the honky tonk arcade and junk shops to the north and the casino to the south. The falls was not a bad walk and the weather was great. Unless you have some physical problems the walk is not a problem. Overall I would recommend this hotel to anyone. You will be pleasantly suprised.
reviews.title: A Hike To The Falls, but An Adequate Hotel with Helpful Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Love the cookies! The staff was very helpful and answered every question we asked. It is a hike to the falls and to Clifton Hill - there are other places a lot close to either. Everything was clean and the room was adequate - nothing special. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: 8 Times and never been tried of the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was clean and nicely appointed, staff was attentive to our needs. It wasn't over the top special in any way to make me feel like I couldn't necessarily do better elsewhere if we go back in the future. Hotel owners apparently skimp on booze. Martini=1oz of vodka for 3 oz price. Don't count on coming back at night for a nightcap.
reviews.title: Not bad, clean, nice view, DO NOT ORDER DRINKS AT HOTEL BAR!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pros: Clean, well appointed room, comfortable beds, great view. Attentive and friendly staff. Onsite restaurant decent. Pool was nice, with hot tub and separate area for adults to swim without being splashed to death by the kiddies.
reviews.title: OK Hotel, but better ones in the city for the price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The cons: Not right in the heart of either main tourist area, kind of between the two. Coffee maker in room smelled (and caused coffee to taste) moldy/funky/god knows what... asked for new machine and it stunk too. Bar was terrible, paid $10 for a one-ounce martini, barely filled half a small martini glass. These people are totally el-cheapo with their booze, treat the stuff like it's liquid gold. DO NOT DRINK ANY BOOZE HERE, STICK TO WINE OR BEER, THEY RIP YOU OFF IN AN ABSOLUTELY CRIMINAL WAY ON HARD STUFF!!!!!!!! Also, a regular room with a king bed with a view is nonexistent, or costs a premium. This is pretty stupid.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Myself and my spouse spent a night at the Double Tree on the 25th and I can't say that we were very impressed. It is far from a terrible hotel but for the money compared to others in the area that I have stayed at it fell short. We were having a romantic night away from the kids and originally wanted a smoking whirlpool room but there were none available ( not the hotels fault obviously) so we decided to book a regular smoking room. That was a mistake( should have just taken a non-smoking whirlpool) avoid the smoking rooms on the 7th floor at all costs! These rooms share a community balcony, which means any guest in these rooms can walk the entire length of the balcony. Which means that if you do not have your blackout curtains drawn then they can see into your room! Could not allow natural light into the room or leave the drapes open and enjoy any view because trying to enjoy a romantic get away we did not need a stranger strolling by at anytime and being able to see into the room. This balcony is a very poor design ( I am in construction and have supplied materials to some of the new hotels and buildings in Niagara Falls and am familiar with their layouts and design) and there should be a railing or wall of some sort seperating each rooms section of the balcony. It was not too romantic to keep the blackout drapes drawn the entire time and still hear people right outside your room on the balcony while you are hoping to enjoy some private times. Not to mention it is a security issue, you do not need your room key to get in and out of the balcony doors and I understand if you leave your key in the room you would be locked out, but I did not see any security cameras covering this area and if you forget to lock that door it provides easy private access into your room not to mention anyone with any skill could gain entry from this private location (If I was the type of person now being familiar with the layout I could book a room in this area and know I have easy access to the others along this balcony) should definately be addressed . We stay in Niagara Falls about 3 times a year between a couple of romantic getaways and an occasional family getaway and feel that for the price there are better options. The condition of the public areas are good and the staff was friendly, I also have nothing but good things to say about the spa ( we enjoyed a wonderful couples massage during our stay). Unfortunately the rooms are no more than your everyday run of the mill room, for similar money there are hotels in the area with better views and the rooms are a bit more impressive or you can get a similar room for less around the city. Can be close to a premier hotel in Niagara but has some simple items to address, but unfortunately these simple items can be enough to turn a guest off.
reviews.title: Disappointed, didn't live up to the reviews I read online

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time in Niagara Falls, Ontario and would recommend Doubletree Fallsview Hotel. Great location and price - no complaints. Would just walk across the border, walk the State Park and return, not worth the expense of staying on the America side but the walk is a definite must. We used 5-0 Taxi service and would also recommend their service from the airport to the falls and any points inbetween.
reviews.title: Nice place but very disappointed with service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this hotel for a 1 night stop in Niagara Falls with my wife (we are 30) because it was one of the cheapest options I could find. I found the lobby to have a delightfully nice decor, the staff were all very nice and welcoming, and the room was nice too. The location is good, near Murray St which is more ideal for adults as there are nice bars and restaurants nearby, as opposed to the Clifton Hill area which is full of child-oriented things. Don't be deceived by the hotel name, you will not get a view of the falls from any room, "Fallsview" just refers to the street the hotel is on. The walk to the falls is about 10 minutes.
reviews.title: Very nice hotel, good location, nice staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautiful hotel in a good location. View of the Falls (if you are on that side ) is nice but distant. Area is very overpriced, but with that in mind, this hotel is one of the best values in the area.
reviews.title: Good Value in an expensive area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Rooms are attractive aNmeticulously clean. Beds are exceptionally comfortable and we we were pleased with the helpful staff. Parking is $12 per night. (told you the area is greatly over priced).
reviews.title: great cookies

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a veiw of the falls and Imax and the skyline tower!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!.Close to a Dairy Queen.Very close to the falls and many casinos
reviews.title: As close to perfect as you can get

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was absolutely great! The price and location was good. We had views of the Falls which we had requested and the hotel was only a few blocks from the falls and all the midway attractions on Clifton Hill. The room was as wonderful as it looked and was described on line. The staff was friendly and helpful. The lobby was something out of a travel magazine and the entire hotel was so clean I could not have done a better job in my own home. Needlesss to say my vacation was extremely close to perfection and a big part was thanks to the Doubletree.When I return to the Niagara falls area there is no doubt where I will be staying.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Terrible Concierge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great location...you could walk to the main attractions if you wanted to. We decided to drove down to the Falls since we had a little toddler we us. Driving to the Falls was no more than 5 minutes away, but BEWARE of parking fees.
reviews.title: Great place to say that 's close but not close to main attractions...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff was nice but we didn't require much assistance when we were there anyway. The indoor pool was great...salt water pool, never crowded and they have a section for adults only. They also had an indoor and outdoor hot tub (awesome at night).
reviews.title: Good location, nice hotel (but...)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our room was on the 9th floor which we were able to watch the fireworks perfectly. Probably the best place to watch since they lasted only about 5 minutes.
reviews.title: Nice style, suite with a great view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a Starbucks in the main lobby which was awesome since hotel coffee is never that great. They even toasted my daughters Pop Tart for her late in the evening.
reviews.title: Great location, lovely view, nice room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: They have a breakfast buffet which I wish we went to instead. We ventured off to the IHOP which was right across the street. Big mistake, waited for 45 minutes to be seated when they said it would only be 10 minutes. Total bill for 2 meals (my daughter and I shared a meal) ...$65!! The breakfast buffet at the hotel would have been $15 for each adult an $7 for kids.
reviews.title: Perfect for our family

aka: Doubletree Fallsview Resort & Spa By Hilton - Niagara Falls Hotel Niagara Falls
description: A relaxing, secure environment removed from-but still close to-the high energy pace of exciting attractions, the American and Canadian Falls (two short blocks) and the Fallsview Casino and Entertainment Complex (400 yards). Convenient on-site parking. Referencing the natural elegance of the Frank Lloyd Wright era and the rustic timeless architecture of a Grand National Park Lodge.
